facts.text: Appellant secured an ex parte decree divorcing his first wife on 6.7.1990
First wife says she never had notice of the said decree or the proceedings commenced by her husband
Appellant underwent a marriage with another lady on 25.5.1993 presumably on the strength of the ex parte decree
First wife succeeded in getting the ex parte decree set aside on 31.3.1994
There is no decree of divorce as between the appellant and his first wife ever since 31.3.1994
First wife filed a complaint against the appellant on 28.3.1995 alleging offence under Section 494 of the IPC
Appellant moved the High Court of Allahabad for quashing the criminal proceedings

legal_issues.text: Whether the appellant can be convicted for the offence under Section 494 IPC for second marriage on 25.5.1993 when ex parte divorce decree was in force but later set aside on 31.3.1994

petitioner_arguments.text: On the date when he contracted the second marriage the first marriage was not subsisting in view of the ex parte decree which continued in force on the said date
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Ex parte decree of divorce dated 6.7.1990

respondent_arguments.text: Did not dispute setting aside of ex parte decree on 31.3.1994 but contended that appellant is guilty of adultery at least from 31.3.1994

court_reasoning.text: If the ex parte decree dated 6.7.1990 was set aside on 31.3.1994, appellant cannot possibly be convicted for offence under Section 494 IPC on premise that he underwent ceremony of marriage with another lady on 25.5.1993
court_reasoning.key_observation: Criminal proceeding for Section 494 IPC is an exercise of futility since no subsisting divorce decree issue affects validity at time of second marriage

court_reasoning.text: Not considering adultery aspect since no complaint filed on that score
court_reasoning.key_observation: Criminal court should not waste time on futile Section 494 proceedings

holdings.text: Appellant cannot be convicted under Section 494 IPC as ex parte decree set aside renders proceedings futile

statutes_cited.name: Indian Penal Code
statutes_cited.relevance: Offence of marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife; proceedings quashed as futile post-set aside of divorce decree

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; impugned order set aside; criminal proceedings pursuant to complaint under Section 494 IPC quashed as futile since ex parte divorce decree was set aside.

key_quotes.text: If that be so, appellant cannot possibly be convicted for the offence under Section 494 of IPC on premise that he had undergone a ceremony of marriage with another lady on 25.5.1993.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: The criminal proceeding now pending against the appellant for the offence under Section 494 of the IPC is only an exercise of futility.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Justification for not wasting court time
